result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Civil Arrest/Body Execution, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid in full by 01-27-2023 or penalty of civil judgment entered for non payment. As an alternative to payment the defendant may complete community service.  Each hour of community service to equal $25.00 towards financial obligations.  Court would accept 13 hours of community service to consider financial obligations paid in full.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Straight time. Sentence credit of 45 days was granted.
Concurrent with: any current sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela L Smith

defendant.name: Smith, Angela L
defendant.address: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd., Waukesha, WI 53186

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Defendant Angela L Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Angela L Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense would like to go to plea and sentencing today.
Court passes matter to take care of some shorter matters first.
Case recalled at 10:34.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
90 Days Jail (Credit for 45 days) CONCURRENT  to any current sentence.

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid by 1/27/23.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.  As an alternative to payment the defendant may complete community service.  Each hour of community service to equal $25.00 towards financial obligations.  Court would accept 13 hours of community service to consider financial obligations paid in full.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

3:03 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Angela L Smith in court, in custody. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
